metadata.Title: CVE-2022-26385 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In unusual circumstances, an individual thread may outlive the thread's manager during shutdown. This could have led to a use-after-free causing a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 98.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-26385` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 98.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
firefox-geckodriver - 98.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
firefox-mozsymbols - 98.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '98.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.2').
